chapter.title: Scope of Delivery
chapter.para:
Talend ESB SE 4.0 is delivered in two separate packages that should be extracted to the same file system location:
talend-esb-4.0.[tar.gz|zip] which contains the software
talend-esb-4.0-doc.[tar.gz|zip] which contains the accompanying documentation and source code for examples.
Here is an overview of the package contents:

row.entry: Libraries required for the Talend ESB Service Locator and Monitoring features
Command line tools/shell scripts (e.g. code generation)
Pre-configured OSGi container based on Eclipse Equinox and Apache Karaf
API documentation for Apache CXF in Javadoc format
Various configuration files for Apache CXF
Libraries required for using Talend ESB (see WHICH_JARS for more details)
License documents for the third party components included in Talend ESB
Libraries that comprise Apache CXF (used to create lightweight distributions of CXF if not all functionality is required)
The standard example source code that comes with Apache CXF and Apache Camel
Apache ZooKeeper which is required for the Talend ESB Service Locator feature
Manuals and User Guides for Talend ESB in PDF format
Extended, documented examples for Talend ESB

chapter.title: New Features, Changes and Fixes
chapter.para: Talend ESB SE bundles Talend Service Factory 2.4.0 and Talend Integration Factory 2.7.1, Service Locator, Service Activity Monitoring and a demo application to a stable, production ready distribution based on the industry leading open source frameworks Apache CXF and Apache Camel.

It includes Web Service support based on JAX-WS and enables simple and scalable message based systems using well known Enterprise Integration Patterns. The Service Locator maintains a repository of service endpoints which can be used by Service Consumers to support loosely coupling, failover and load balancing. Service Activity Monitoring allows to log and monitor service calls. A documented Car Rental demo application illustrates how to use these features.

section.title: Highlighted Features
Service Locator
section.para: The Service Locator in the add-ons directory is a service that provides its consumers with a mechanism to discover service endpoints at run time. The Service Locator consists of two parts: An Endpoint repository and a CXF feature used to configure the use of the Service Locator from both the provider and consumer sides. Like any standard CXF feature, the ServiceLocator Feature is configured separately for the service provider and service consumer. The provider side Locator Feature extension registers and deregisters service endpoints in the endpoint repository when the provider becomes available or unavailable. The consumer side Locator Feature extension transparently retrieves service endpoint addresses from the endpoint repository when a service call to a provider is to be made.

section.section: Service Activity Monitoring (SAM) The Service Activity Monitoring (SAM) in the add-ons directory allows to log / monitor service calls done with the Apache CXF Framework. Typical use cases are usage statistics and fault monitoring. The solution consists of two parts: Agent (sam-agent) and Monitoring Server (sam-server). The Agent creates events out of the requests and replies on service consumer and provider side. The events are first collected locally and then sent to the monitoring server periodically to not disturb the normal message flow. The Monitoring Server receives events from the Agent, optionally filters/handlers events and stores them into a Database.

chapter.title: Known Limitations

para.emphasis: SAM Server only works on Tomcat 6 but not on ESB Server OSGi container

chapter.para: In this release of the Talend ESB the Service Activity Management (SAM) Server needs to be deployed on Tomcat 6. In future versions of Talend ESB we will also support the deployment within the Talend ESB OSGi container.

chapter.title: Reporting Defects and Issues
chapter.para: For community technical support use the Talend User's Forum at http://www.talendforge.org/forum/ - ‘Talend ESB’. You can also look at the Open and Fixed issues provided in the Bug tracker https://jira.sopera.de/secure/Dashboard.jspa - Project: Talend ESB

If you have a valid customer support contract for Talend ESB (SE/EE) with Talend you can access the Talend Online Helpdesk or you can contact customer support by phone and e-mail as stated in your contracts.

Please provide the following information:
Product and Version which you used (for example, Talend ESB 4.0 SE)
Version of Java Platform JDK / JRE in use.
Log files
Also, in order to ensure that the technical support team has sufficient information to help you, describe at least the following in detail:
your actions up to the point when the problem occurred
the results you expected
the ensuing results that differ from your expected results.
